comment.author: 31580040@N04
comment._content: Typo in your title and caption, he isn't Wislon.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: LOC --- you have a double typo: you have misspelled Wilson, and "Carlile" has no ESS.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: He was the founder of the "Church Army," the Anglican church's mission to working-class Englishmen (who felt excluded from organized religion because of British society's rigid class structure). (The CA was the official Church of England's answer to the Salvation Army, which had been founded four years earlier, and was regarded by the church as a renegade outfit.) Carlile (note the odd spelling) was in the news at the time in 1914 when Bain circulated this photo to his subscribers, having been received by King George V at Buckingham Palace, on February 13, 1914. New York Times story, February 14: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9F06EFDF153DE7...

comment.author: 34911459@N08
comment._content: Thanks.  We will make the corrections in the record.
